result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darrion L. Allen

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darrion L. Allen in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher William Rose in court for Darrion L. Allen.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Binger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk JT  Minutes: ST called witness PPPD Ofc Patrick Gainer; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Rose. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.   Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

109PM   Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Chris Rose.   Clerk JT  Minutes: Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:30 am. before Comm, 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI. mi

ADDRESS INFO for Darrion L. Allen
Current: LKA 4914 36th Ave #4, Kenosha, WI 53144   (Effective: 07-15-2022)
Prior: 4914 36th Ave #4, Kenosha, WI 53144
Notice of assignment of judge returned.  Return to sender.  Attempted, not known.  Unable to forward.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Darrion L. Allen in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Applicant is eligible for SPD services, no attorney assigned

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Weapons especially firearms.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Ted T, Timber Ridge Mobile Home Park.

01:32 PM   Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Toni Young.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:15 am. $2500 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). mi
